content: Which British rock band released a self-titled album in 1969 that is often referred to as the "White Album" due to its plain white cover?

That would be The Beatles. Their self-titled album, often known as the "White Album," was released in 1968, not 1969. It's called the "White Album" because its cover is predominantly white with no identifying marks apart from the band's name embossed on the record sleeve. It's one of their most famous and influential works, featuring a diverse range of songs that showcase the band's broad musical talents.
